title: Consent to Establish (CTE) & Consent to Operate (CTO) — Goa
description: Pollution consents required under the Water (1974) and Air (1981) Acts before setting up and for ongoing operations in Goa. Applies to a wide range of MSME activities (manufacturing, hotels, food processing, printing, fabrication, etc.).
eligibility: Any unit in Goa that sets up or operates processes emitting effluents/air emissions or generating controlled wastes.
process: Apply online via Goa OCMMS; submit site/layout plan, details of process & emissions, pollution-control measures, fees. Obtain CTE prior to installation; CTO prior to operation; renew CTO per validity.
benefits: Legal operation, avoidance of closure directions/penalties, smoother inspections and financing.
deadlines: CTE prior to construction/installation; CTO prior to start of operations; renewal as per consent validity.

title: Environmental Clearance (EC) — Goa SEIAA
issuingAuthority: Goa State Environment Impact Assessment Authority (SEIAA)
description: Prior Environmental Clearance under EIA Notification 2006 (and amendments) for listed project categories located in Goa. Screening, scoping, public consultation (where applicable), appraisal, and EC grant at state level.
eligibility: Projects/activities falling under EIA Schedule categories handled by SEIAA (state level) or by MoEFCC (central level) as applicable.
process: Prepare Form-1/1A, pre-feasibility report, EIA/EMP (if required); file on Parivesh portal; attend appraisal; obtain EC and comply with conditions.
benefits: Legal sanction to commence construction/operation; bankability; stakeholder confidence.
deadlines: Prior to construction or land development; validity and amendment timelines as per EC letter.

title: Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ) & CZMP — Goa
description: Activities and developments within Goa’s CRZ areas must comply with national CRZ notifications and the notified Goa Coastal Zone Management Plan (CZMP). GCZMA regulates permissions and enforces violations.
eligibility: Any activity within CRZ areas (sea shore, rivers/creeks with tidal influence) including tourism structures, shore facilities, dredging, etc.
process: Verify plot against CZMP maps (CRZ-I/II/III/IV, NDZ etc.); prepare application with drawings, HTL/LTL demarcation (where required); obtain GCZMA permission and comply with conditions.
benefits: Lawful coastal development; reduced litigation/demolition risk.
deadlines: Prior to any CRZ-regulated activity; time-bound compliances as per approval.

title: Goa Non-Biodegradable Garbage (Control) Act, 1996
description: State law governing segregation, storage, collection and disposal of non-biodegradable garbage; duties for occupiers, shops and establishments to prevent littering and ensure compliant handling.
eligibility: All shops, commercial establishments, hotels, industrial units and institutions in Goa.
process: Provide bins/segregation, handover to authorised collection agencies; comply with local bye-laws; avoid littering/illegal dumping.
benefits: Avoid penalties; cleaner premises; alignment with SWM Rules.
deadlines: Continuous compliance; local inspection schedules apply.

title: Goa, Daman & Diu Preservation of Trees Act, 1984
description: Regulates felling and transport of specified trees. Permissions are mandatory prior to felling or site clearance; compensatory planting may be required.
eligibility: Any entity proposing to fell/transport notified species on private or public land in Goa.
process: Apply to Tree Authority/Forest Dept. with site plan and species list; obtain felling permission; comply with conditions and transit permits.
benefits: Avoid penalties and project stoppage; landscape compliance.
deadlines: Prior to tree cutting/land development; as per permission validity.

title: Goa Ground Water Regulation — Permits & Transport
issuingAuthority: Dept. of Water Resources (Goa Ground Water Cell)
description: Regulates drilling of borewells/tubewells, extraction and transport of groundwater in Goa. Recent rule amendments streamline permits and monitoring.
eligibility: Any unit extracting/transporting groundwater (hotels, beverage/food units, manufacturing, construction).
process: Apply for drilling/extraction permission; install meters if mandated; maintain logs; renew permissions; obtain transport permits where applicable.
benefits: Legal extraction; avoids sealing/penalties; sustainable water use.
deadlines: Prior to drilling/extraction; renewal per permit conditions.

title: People’s Biodiversity Register (PBR) / GSBB
description: Local Biodiversity Management Committees prepare PBRs documenting biological resources and associated knowledge; relevant for projects using bio-resources or near sensitive areas.
eligibility: Enterprises interacting with biological resources or operating near sensitive ecosystems; projects requiring consultation with BMCs.
process: Engage relevant Biodiversity Management Committee; reference local PBR; obtain necessary consents if accessing bio-resources.
benefits: Community alignment, reduced conflict, compliance with Biological Diversity Act.
deadlines: During project planning and prior to bio-resource access.

title: Waste Authorisations (Hazardous, BMW, SWM, Plastic, E-waste, Battery) — Goa
description: Obtain applicable authorisations/registrations under national waste rules as enforced in Goa: Hazardous & Other Wastes (2016), Bio-Medical Waste (2016), Solid Waste Management (2016), Plastic Waste (2016), E-Waste (2022), Battery Waste (2022).
eligibility: Units generating/handling the respective waste streams (workshops, clinics, hospitality, electronics, packaging users, battery producers/importers, etc.).
process: Apply on relevant portals (GSPCB/central EPR) with waste details; maintain records; file returns; use authorised handlers/recyclers.
deadlines: At commissioning and ongoing (returns/renewals) per rule.
